sect1.title: Device Driver Utility 1.2 Overview
sect1.para: Device Driver Utility 1.2 is an application that provides information about those devices of your native system that have the OpenSolaris 2009.06 Operating System (OS) installed. Device Driver Utility enables you to connect to the Image Packaging System (IPS) and search device drivers for the devices that do not have drivers attached to them. IPS is a repository for the OpenSolaris OS packages. You can find suitable drivers for the devices in this repository. Use the Device Driver Utility application to perform the following functions:

listitem.para: Get information about devices installed on your native system and check whether their corresponding device drivers exist.
Search the IPS repository for your system devices that do not have corresponding driver attached.
Download and install the device drivers from the IPS for devices on your system.
Submit system configurations to HCL.

sect1.para: Device Driver Utility 1.2 is integrated with the OpenSolaris 2009.06 OS. This utility requires at least Python version 2.4 and Perl version 5.8. However, the OpenSolaris 2009.06 OS is by default integrated with Perl version 5.8 and Python version 2.4.
To report a bug or for any suggestion, send an email to driver-utility-feedback@sun.com.

sect1.title: Device Driver Utility 1.2 Interface
sect1.para: To invoke Device Driver Utility 1.2 click Applications->System Tools->Device Driver Utility on the OpenSolaris 2009.06 OS desktop. The Device Driver Utility window is displayed.

The Types column shows the device category names. Various device categories are Audio, CPU, DVD, Memory, Network, Storage, USB, Video, and Other. If you are using a laptop, there will be a battery category shown up which gives information about your laptop's battery. The Device column shows the list of controllers and device names corresponding to each device category. The Driver column shows the names of the existing device drivers or the status of the existing device driver for each device.
The status of the device driver can be one of the following:

listitem.para: Driver Missing: Indicates that there is no driver attached to the device.
Driver Available: Indicates that there is no driver in the system but the driver exists in the IPS.
Driver Unavailable: Indicates that there is no driver in the system or in the IPS.
Driver Misconfigured: Indicates that the driver does not function properly.
Third-party Driver: Indicates that a third-party driver exists for the device.

sect1.para: The name of the device driver is displayed if the driver exists for the respected device in the system.
The Device Driver Utility window provides the following buttons:

listitem.para: Refresh: Directs the system to search for devices. If the status of the device driver is Driver Missing, click the Refresh button. This searches the system for the devices and their corresponding drivers and displays the information. This action might change the previous status of the device driver.
Help: Displays the online help for Device Driver Utility.
Close: Closes the Device Driver Utility.
Submit: Submits the configurations of your system to the OpenSolaris hardware compatibility list (HCL).
When you click the Submit button, the Submit Information To HCL window is displayed. Type the following system information in the corresponding fields:
System type: Select the type of the system from the drop-down list.
Manufacture name: Type the name of the system maker such as Hewlett-Packard or Dell.
Model: Type the complete model number for the system being tested, such as HP xw8400 Workstation.
BIOS/Firmware Maker: Type the information on the BIOS Setup screen that is usually displayed while booting the system.
CPU type: Type the name of the CPU maker. For instance, Intel(R)Xeon(R)CPU5130@2.00GHz.
Information Collected: Verify whether this information reflects the details that you have specified and submit the same to Sun.

General Notes: Type any additional information of the system whose details are submitted. You can also type the information of how successfully you got the system and components to work with the OpenSolaris OS.
Install All Drivers: Installs all the missing drivers. The Install All Drivers pop-up window is displayed indicating the progress of installation.

sect1.title: Working with Device Driver Utility 1.2
sect1.para: To get the hardware details of your system:

listitem.para: Right click on any device and click Detail Information. The Hardware Detail Information pop-up window is displayed where you can find the details of your system's hardware.

figure.title: Device Driver Utility Detail Information Window

textobject.phrase: Device Driver Utility Detail Information Window

sect1.para: To install missing drivers:

listitem.para: Right click on any device and click Install Driver. The Install Driver pop-up window is displayed indicating the progress of installation.

figure.title: Device Driver Utility Install Driver Window

textobject.phrase: Device Driver Utility Install Driver Window

sect1.para: To get the details of the third-party drivers:

listitem.para: When you click the Refresh button, Device Driver Utility searches the system to check for the existing device drivers of your system. If a third-party driver exists for the device, the information about the third-party driver including the URL to download is displayed in the Detail Information window.

sect1.para: To Submit your System to HCL:

listitem.para: Using Device Driver utility, you can submit your system information to Hardware Compatibility List (HCL) by clicking the Submit button. Upon submission, you will get an acknowledgement of your submission and a link where your submission is available. The Sun auditing team will check and publish your system information to HCL.
